intro: Mikania kleiniana, commonly known as the Mexican devil's ivy, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It is a member of the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its rapid growth and trailing habit. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in heads, typical of the daisy family. Its leaves are heart-shaped and often have a velvety texture. Mikania kleiniana is often used in landscaping due to its ornamental value and ability to thrive in various conditions.
